intro: Justicia orchioides, commonly known as the orchid jewel or orchid-leaf false arum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, orchid-like flowers that are often brightly colored. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a popular choice for tropical gardens and botanical collections.
